intro: Chloraea multilamellata, commonly known as the mountain bellflower, is a striking perennial plant native to the alpine regions of South America. It belongs to the Boraginaceae family and is characterized by its vibrant blue or purple flowers that bloom in late spring. The plant has a compact growth habit with hairy stems and lance-shaped leaves that are often covered in fine pubescence. Its flowers are arranged in clusters and are known for their bell-like shape, which gives the species its common name. Chloraea multilamellata thrives in cool, moist environments and is often found in mountainous areas with well-drained soils.
